Someone asked how to expand startups' ideas. The best way is to shrink the idea down to its essence, then ask how broadly that essential idea could be expanded. You have to shrink it first, though, or there will be random stuff left in it that impedes its expansion.

user.name: Peter H. Diamandis, MD
user.description: Exec. Chairman @XPRIZE @fountainlife_hq (and others) Working to extend human healthspan.

fullText: If you think a solution was easy... It would've already been done. Keep motivated and develop your passion and ideas.

I've been doing office hours with startups for 20 years now. I must have talked to over a thousand of them. How have I not become bored by it? I think the reason is curiosity. Each startup's idea is different, and it's a puzzle to figure out how to make it work.

fullText:
Most people will test GPT-5 on simple reasoning and coding.

However, where GPT-5 excels is in long context understanding, instruction following, and intent detection.

This makes it the best model for filling in the gaps...

And an absolute beast for building AI agents. https://t.co/xAl5mWWTeP
